news_header: A Pakistani man was sentenced to 30 years for a 2020 knife attack outside Charlie Hebdo's former offices in Paris.
news_text: Zaheer Mahmood, 29, was found guilty of attempted murder and terrorism for a knife attack in September 2020 that injured two people. He mistakenly believed he was targeting Charlie Hebdo employees, unaware that the magazine had relocated after a deadly attack in 2015. Mahmood, radicalized by an extremist preacher, entered France illegally in 2019 and felt disconnected from his surroundings. Five other Pakistani men were also sentenced for aiding him.
